body: We can clean up later... the good thing now is I can throw some heavier machinery at it.

I wrote `_channel_test.py` weeks ago with the specific thought in mind of isolating a defect in a small enough cage that we could hand it off to you... and then [this happened](http://i.imgur.com/k1R3xzy.gif). I am _very_ excited to see where this goes.

Very nice result here! The fix also seems clear, which is nice.

On Fri, Mar 11, 2016 at 5:59 PM Nathaniel Manista notifications@github.com

There's more investigation to do: this test still doesn't pass cleanly.

I absolutely love not passing tests.
(That are isolated enough to be studied)

This has now reached 4000 runs on my machine without failing. Calling this good enough for review.
According to @soltanmm, this seems to be fixing https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/5458
I will shake my fists at the sky if this doesn't fix #5458.
LGTM except for a few truly nit-sized comments. Nice race detection and cleanup!
@jtattermusch if you would like to merge, please do so. None of my nits are functional, and I have assigned cleanup issue  #5746 to @soltanmm .
Merging as this should address some python flakes.
